intro: Pavetta subcuneata, commonly known as the narrow-angled pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It produces small, fleshy berries that are typically red when mature. Pavetta subcuneata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
